results.title: Supersonic
results.brief_description: In 1956 it had all begun, the sound barrier had been broken and a handful of men were thinking of making a passenger airline to break the sound barrier - to halve the world. In 1959, real work was begun on the idea. The French and the British consolidated to save time and money. In 1962 a model of the aircraft was shown at Farnsborough Air Show, and it was named “Concorde”. America became interested, and not wanting to be left behind, began designing their own sound breaking passenger aircraft. The race was on - neither of the parties wanting to make any mistakes, both very meticulous in their research. This documentary is mostly made up of interviews with the chief personnel (French, English and American) involved in designing, testing and investigating the construction of a supersonic aircraft. Commentary by Michael Flanders.

results.title: Supermarkets and the farmer
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Larry Gosnell
results.brief_description: This film about food and the food dollar examines its value for farmer, consumer and vendor. What control has the farmer over the price he gets? What control has the consumer over the price he pays? What does the supermarket give and what does it take? To answer these questions, some knowledgeable people are presented: heads of food-store chains, economists, farmers, housewives and small storekeepers.

results.title: Superman: the movie
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Pierre Spengler and Richard Donner
results.brief_description: Superman: the movie is an immensely entertaining recount of the origin of the famous comic book character. Opening on Krypton (where Marlon Brando plays Superman’s father), the film follows the Man of Steel as he’s sent to Earth where he develops his alter-ego, Clark Kent, and is raised by a Midwestern rural family. At the age of 30, Clark loses his earthly father and moves to the city, getting a job as news reporter at the Daily Planet. It’s here that he falls in love with Lois Lane, who is already in love with Superman. The love story is quickly sidetracked once the infamous and villainous Lex Luthor launches a diabolical plan to conquer the world and kill Superman. Includes film story by Mario Puzo. Cast includes Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder, Ned Beatty, Jackie Cooper, Glenn Ford and Susannah York.

results.title: Superman II
results.creator_credit: Alexander Salkind and Ilya Salkind Productions, Pierre Spengler and Richard Lester
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “Superman: the movie”, the Man of Steel’s romance with Lois Lane begins to blossom just as three villains from Krypton - who all have powers to match Superman’s - arrive on Earth with the intention of destroying the planet. With the help of arch-criminal Lex Luthor, the three locate Superman and when the truth is uncovered about Superman’s past - he being the son of their jailer - they seek to avenge Jor-El by killing his only son. The battle between Good and Evil culminates in a spectacular duel above Metropolis, and ends back at Superman’s home, where with a tricky manoeuvre, Superman restores order and peace on Earth. Cast includes: Christopher Reeve, Margot Kidder, Gene Hackman and Terrence Stamp.

creators_primary.name: Alexander Salkind and Ilya Salkind Productions

results.title: Superman and the bride
results.brief_description: Sets out to take a hard look at the main messages that come to us daily from the media, focusing on images of men and women. Does the mass media give us an accurate picture of the sexes or do they serve up a stereotype diet of sexy, passive females and tough, dynamic males? This atempts to answer these questions using satire, songs, cartoons and clips from film. Cast includes Julie Covington, Jane Meadows, Charlie Stafford. Narrated by Gavin Richards, Stephanie Turner.

results.title: Superhuman : The awesome power within
results.creator_credit: BBC, TLC Films and David Hickman
results.brief_description: From the makers of “The Human body” series, this ground-breaking series shows how pioneers at the cutting edge of medicine are shaping our physical future by utilising the body’s extraordinary capacity for self-repair and reinvention. “Trauma” explores what happens to the human body after exposure to trauma, such as a car crash. “Spare parts” investigates the ways of tricking the body into accepting foreign organs, such as cochlear implants. “Self-repair” explores research into growing “spare” organs to replace human body parts that wear out. “Killers into cures” looks at the very real threat of too little exposure to infection, thus allowing allergies and auto-immune diseases the most dangerous threats to health. “The Alien within” explores how cancer lives inside the body like a parasite, grows its own support system and eventually overwhelms its host. “The Baby builders” looks at the enormous advances in reproductive technology and genetics, which have allowed science to hold immense influence over the evolution of the human race.
